intro: Chatinia, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Peru and Bolivia. The plant is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. Chatinia species are typically herbaceous and grow in high-altitude environments. Due to their rarity and specific habitat requirements, they are of interest to botanists and conservationists.
